title: mirakal
author: mirakal
content: Hello! I'd like to pose a question to my fellow gamblers here. Since the topic of sports betting has been gaining attention recently, allow me to ask:So, the question is... Which are you better at: selecting the right bet or managing your bankroll?And, how has it been going so far? Are you profitable or not, and why?

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: Honest answer. I am not in profit right now in both sports betting and casino games. But I do think I have more losses in casinos than it is with sports betting.You can see me mostly in the NBA betting thread and most of the time I am 1/3, 2/4, or worse 1/4 in my bet results. It's not easy to make a perfect bet anymore either I lack the spreads or I got greedy and took the highest handicap that is available. NBA suddenly got predictable because of the changes in the rosters and rookies had been stepping up their games making other known weak teams become stronger that is why the spreads are harder to reach.Then, I have player props as my side bet which I usually don't share. Not that I don't want to but because it's too long that it might fill my whole reply with it.  Despite that, I still think I am better off with sports betting. Casino games are so hungry that they swallow my wallet immediately, winning moments are too rare and because of that I actually seldom play casino games now. I don't want to lose all my balance there because I am saving it for sports where my chances are higher, in my own computation. It's a long battle in sports betting but it's more fun and the risk is lower when you do your homework.

comments.author: stadus
comments.body: I can say I'm good at picking the right bet but my problem is sometimes I go so aggressive. Just like other gamblers, we want to make big money in gambling so we don't manage our bankroll properly. For successful sports bettors, they have a decent bankroll and they'll be happy if they are up at least 100% at the end of the season like the NBA, but us gamblers, we are so reckless, we want 1000% return in just a short period of time.

comments.author: Ultegra134
comments.body: I'm not quite sure which one to answer; I'd say a little bit of both. I generally am a little picky on my bets, taking time to consider how much I'm going to bet and with what odds, on what game, etc., while also being a little reserved to not exceed a certain budget. I try not to keep a large amount of money on my account; something like $50 to $100 seems okay, while it's usually on the lower side ($50-$60). I always withdraw any earnings and stick to leaving some funds on my account.That way, even if I get irritated and emotional after losing a few bets, because it'll happen eventually and we're humans, it's not always easy to control your feelings, especially if you're not having a good day, it's inconvenient for me to bet more money. I wouldn't go through the trouble of depositing more funds; I'd have let off steam by then and wouldn't need to play anymore at that point.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: I'd say managing my bankroll is what I'm currently good at, as it's completely under my control. Unlike predicting games, that always changes to negative results before the game is over. Judging from the recent results of big teams losing their games. Many players lose their predictions and don't understand why a team like Arsenal won't be able to score a single goal. I'd play clubs like Arsenal to score, not to win, but the game results don't fit into any of those categories. Imagine millions of people who would stake Arsenal to score. They'll all lose their money. So, since the money management depends on the gambler, it's better to bet a small amount on such games than wagering too much hoping to win big. However, the regret comes when the team ends up winning the game. The gambler will feel greedy, and think he would have won bigger rewards if he wagered more money. Sometimes the risk is worth it, and another way around it's safe to manage our funds. Instead of losing out on a game that'll consume a huge portion of our savings.

comments.author: Yaunfitda
comments.body: Quote from: mirakal on December 11, 2023, 05:26:34 AMHello! I'd like to pose a question to my fellow gamblers here. Since the topic of sports betting has been gaining attention recently, allow me to ask:So, the question is... Which are you better at: selecting the right bet or managing your bankroll?And, how has it been going so far? Are you profitable or not, and why?I think that the most gamblers are looking at their bankroll because once you deposit, you know that you have put a big risk on your capital that you are going to lose your money already. So for me, it should be selecting the right bet, no question about it.We don't worry about our bankroll, and as long as we bet and win some, we can extend that bankroll as long as we can. Of course, there are also the element of luck here, and that we might not last with that bankroll. But at least you have control of what you bet and what you deem can make you more money then go for it. Instead of looking at your capital and that might put more pressure on you to make the correct bet.

comments.author: Assface16678
comments.body: Quote from: mirakal on December 11, 2023, 05:26:34 AMHello! I'd like to pose a question to my fellow gamblers here. Since the topic of sports betting has been gaining attention recently, allow me to ask:So, the question is... Which are you better at: selecting the right bet or managing your bankroll?And, how has it been going so far? Are you profitable or not, and why?If I'm one of the two, I would say I'm on the managing your bankroll side, because every bet and gambling I do is all recorded for me to keep track of my earnings. For example, when I have allocated capital for my gambling games and betting games, all of the transactions I do are recorded, and the either win or lose amount is recorded. I do this thing for me to keep track of what's happening to my capital, whether it's earning or not. From that, I could manage my capital and either stop or play games that have a higher chance of winning, but if at some point the whole capital burns, then only that allocated money will be the one who's going to lose. It's like I'm setting up a wall to limit my spending so I can manage my bankroll efficiently. because I'm confident enough to say that I'm a responsible gambler who has discipline and good management of my money.

comments.author: 0t3p0t
comments.body: Managing the bankroll is for me more challenging than choosing the right bet. Selecting the right bet is too easy for me as it will only requires history or records of performances to analyse and that may give me an idea which one to place a bet. Managing our own bankroll is complicated most specially if we are having no limits and discipline. Sometimes emotions will dictate what to do that could lead to mismanagement or mishandling of funds. More example about bankroll management is that our priorities are also the factors we have to rethink and make critical decisions.

comments.author: Mauser
comments.body: Quote from: mirakal on December 11, 2023, 05:26:34 AMSo, the question is... Which are you better at: selecting the right bet or managing your bankroll?And, how has it been going so far? Are you profitable or not, and why?I am definitely better at the latter, managing my bankroll is more easy for me than picking the right bet to place my money on. When I compare myself to my friends, I know that I am not the best person to place profitable bets. A few of my friends are quite successful in football betting because they follow the league into the smalles detail. I am more of a big picture kind of guy and only really follow my home team, which makes it a bid hard to give accurate predictions and place my bets accordingly. However, remaining in full control of my money is for me the key to remain profitable. Learning how to control your bankroll is what saved me from not going broke over the years of my gambling history. I think it came from the strong focus on poker in my early days on gambling, because you need to have a close eye on your bankroll all the time and adapt quickly. You can only move up the stakes when making money, and as soon as you lose money you need also lower the stakes again. There will be losing streaks and we need to have the capital to survive it.

comments.author: killerfrost
comments.body: IMO, both of these factors should be balanced during the betting process because any factor can affect the result. Even though I'm not a good player, frankly I lose more than I win so I can somewhat see the cause of my failures. But I'm still inclined to seek entertainment, so the results really aren't that important to me. In this field, as I understand it, it also requires a lot of learning, if you just play by your normal instincts, you will receive more pain.selecting the right bet and managing your bankroll , matter how much these rules are followed, the results are a reflection of the extent to which the player can apply them.

comments.author: DabsPoorVersion
comments.body: I can say, I'm good at selecting the right bet than managing my bankroll. Choosing the right bet is all about statistics and analyzing the records/data when selecting the right bet that's why I find it easy and for most people. Well, the same with bankroll management, most people find it easy as they only need to set an amount or percentage from their bankroll on every bet they make. However, this requires to be a disciplined gambler.  Which is not I am not good at. I still find myself to continue to lose my patience sometimes.
